Agents package

Submodules

Dqn_agents module

class CoBeLRL.agents.dqn_agents.DQNAgentBaseline(interfaceOAI, memoryCapacity=10000, epsilon=0.3, processor=None, trialBeginFcn=None, trialEndFcn=None, lr=0.001, network=None)

Bases: object

This is a reinforcement learning class. It wraps all functionality required to set up a RL agent. This is the constructor method. The sequential model is developed and the agent is constructed.

class callbacks(rlParent, trialBeginFcn=None, trialEndFcn=None)

Bases: keras.callbacks.Callback

This nested visualization class is required by ‘KERAS-RL’ to visualize the training success (by means of episode reward) at the end of each episode, and update the policy visualization.

__init__(rlParent, trialBeginFcn=None, trialEndFcn=None)

Inits nested visualization class is required by ‘KERAS-RL’ to visualize the training success (by means of episode reward) at the end of each episode, and update the policy visualization.

Parameters

  • rlParent – The ACT_ReinforcementLearningModule that hosts this class

  • trialBeginFcn – The callback function called in the beginning of each trial, defined for more flexibility in scenario control

  • trialEndFcn – The callback function called at the end of each trial, defined for more flexibility in scenario control

Returns

None

on_episode_begin(epoch, logs)

The function is called whenever an episode starts, and updates the visual output in the plotted reward graphs.

Parameters

  • epoch – The number of passes of the dataset

  • logs – Log data

Returns

None

on_episode_end(epoch, logs)

The function is called whenever an episode ends, and updates the reward accumulator, simultaneously updating the visualization of the reward function.

Parameters

  • epoch – The number of passes of the dataset

  • logs – Log data

Returns

None

__init__(interfaceOAI, memoryCapacity=10000, epsilon=0.3, processor=None, trialBeginFcn=None, trialEndFcn=None, lr=0.001, network=None)

Inits a reinforcement learning class. It wraps all functionality required to set up a RL agent.

Parameters

  • interfaceOAI – The interface to the Open AI Gym environment

  • memoryCapacity – The capacity of the sequential memory used in the agent

  • epsilon – The epsilon value for the epsilon greedy policy

  • processor – Abstract base class for implementing processor

  • trialBeginFcn – The callback function called at the beginning of each trial, defined for more flexibility in scenario control

  • trialEndFcn – The callback function called at the end of each trial, defined for more flexibility in scenario control

  • lr – The learning rate with which the Q-function is updated.

  • network – The DNN to be used by the agent. If None, a dense DNN is created by default.

Returns

None

train(steps)

This method is called to train the agent using the fit method.

Parameters

steps – Maximum number of steps required to train the model.

Returns

None

Dyna_dqn module

class CoBeLRL.agents.dyna_dqn.DynaDQN(interfaceOAI, epsilon=0.3, beta=5, learningRate=0.9, gamma=0.99, trialEndFcn=None, observations=None, model=None)

Bases: agents.dyna_q_agent.AbstractDynaQAgent

Implementation of a DQN agent using the Dyna-Q model. This agent uses the Dyna-Q agent’s memory module and then maps gridworld states to predefined observations.

class callbacks(rlParent, trialEndFcn=None)

Bases: object

Callback class. Used for visualization and scenario control.

__init__(rlParent, trialEndFcn=None)

Inits callback class

Parameters

  • rlParent – Reference to the Dyna-Q agent.

  • trialEndFcn – Maximum number of experiences that will be stored by the memory module.

Returns

None

on_episode_end(epoch, logs)

This function is called whenever an episode ends, and updates the reward accumulator, simultaneously updating the visualization of the reward function.

Parameters

  • epoch – The number of passes of the dataset

  • logs – log data

Returns

None

__init__(interfaceOAI, epsilon=0.3, beta=5, learningRate=0.9, gamma=0.99, trialEndFcn=None, observations=None, model=None)

Inits DQN agent using the Dyna-Q model

Parameters

  • interfaceOAI – The interface to the Open AI Gym environment.

  • epsilon – The epsilon value for the epsilon greedy policy.

  • beta – The temperature parameter used when applying the softmax function to the Q-values.

  • learningRate – The learning rate with which the Q-function is updated.

  • gamma – The discount factor used to compute the TD-error.

  • trialEndFcn – Callback function called at the end of each trial, defined for flexibility in scenario control.

  • observations – The set of observations that will be mapped to the gridworld states.

  • model – The DNN model to be used by the agent.

Returns

None

build_model(model=None)

This function builds the DQN’s target and online models.

Parameters

model – The DNN model to be used by the agent. If None, a small dense DNN is created by default.

Returns

None

train(numberOfTrials=100, maxNumberOfSteps=50, replayBatchSize=100, noReplay=False)

This function is called to train the agent.

Parameters

  • numberOfTrials – The number of trials the Dyna-Q agent is trained.

  • maxNumberOfSteps – The maximum number of steps per trial.

  • replayBatchSize – The number of random that will be replayed.

  • noReplay – If true, experiences are not replayed.

Returns

None

replay(replayBatchSize=200)

This function replays experiences to update the Q-function.

Parameters

replayBatchSize – The number of random that will be replayed.

Returns

None

update_Q(experience)

This function is a dummy function and does nothing (implementation required by parent class).

Parameters

experience – The experience with which the Q-function will be updated.

Returns

None

retrieve_Q(state)

This function retrieves Q-values for a given state.

Parameters

state – The state for which Q-values should be retrieved.

Returns

Q-values

predict_on_batch(batch)

This function retrieves Q-values for a batch of states.

Parameters

batch – The batch of states.

Returns

Q-values on batch of states

Dyna_q_agent module

class CoBeLRL.agents.dyna_q_agent.AbstractDynaQAgent(interfaceOAI, epsilon=0.3, beta=5, learningRate=0.9, gamma=0.99)

Bases: object

Implementation of a Dyna-Q agent. Q-function is represented as a static table.

__init__(interfaceOAI, epsilon=0.3, beta=5, learningRate=0.9, gamma=0.99)

Inits Dyna-Q agent class

Parameters

  • interfaceOAI – The interface to the Open AI Gym environment.

  • epsilon – The epsilon value for the epsilon greedy policy.

  • learningRate – The learning rate with which the Q-function is updated.

  • gamma – The discount factor used to compute the TD-error.

Returns

None

replay(replayBatchSize=200)

This function replays experiences to update the Q-function.

Parameters

replayBatchSize – The number of random that will be replayed.

Returns

None

select_action(state, epsilon=0.3, beta=5)

This function selects an action according to the Q-values of the current state.

Parameters

  • state – The current state.

  • epsilon – The epsilon parameter used under greedy action selection.

  • beta – The temperature parameter used when applying the softmax function to the Q-values.

Returns

Action

compute_action_mask()

This function computes the action mask which prevents the selection of invalid actions.

Param

None

Returns

None

train(numberOfTrials=100, maxNumberOfSteps=50, replayBatchSize=100, noReplay=False)

This function is called to train the agent.

Parameters

  • numberOfTrials – The number of trials the Dyna-Q agent is trained.

  • maxNumberOfSteps – The maximum number of steps per trial.

  • replayBatchSize – The number of random that will be replayed.

  • noReplay – If true, experiences are not replayed.

Returns

None

class CoBeLRL.agents.dyna_q_agent.DynaQAgent(interfaceOAI, epsilon=0.3, beta=5, learningRate=0.9, gamma=0.99, trialEndFcn=None)

Bases: CoBeLRL.agents.dyna_q_agent.AbstractDynaQAgent

Implementation of a Dyna-Q agent. Q-function is represented as a static table.

Parameters

  • interfaceOAI – The interface to the Open AI Gym environment.

  • epsilon – The epsilon value for the epsilon greedy policy.

  • learningRate – The learning rate with which the Q-function is updated.

  • gamma – The discount factor used to compute the TD-error.

  • trialEndFcn – The callback function called at the end of each trial, defined for more flexibility in scenario control.

Returns

None

on_episode_end(epoch, logs)

The following function is called whenever an episode ends, and updates the reward accumulator, simultaneously updating the visualization of the reward function.

Parameters

  • epoch – Reference to the Dyna-Q agent.

  • logs – Maximum number of experiences that will be stored by the memory module.

Returns

None

__init__(interfaceOAI, epsilon=0.3, beta=5, learningRate=0.9, gamma=0.99, trialEndFcn=None)

This is the constructor method.

Parameters

  • interfaceOAI – The interface to the Open AI Gym environment.

  • epsilon – The epsilon value for the epsilon greedy policy.

  • learningRate – The learning rate with which the Q-function is updated.

  • gamma – The discount factor used to compute the TD-error.

  • trialEndFcn – The callback function called at the end of each trial, defined for more flexibility in scenario control.

Returns

None

Parameters

  • maxNumberOfSteps – The maximum number of steps per trial.

  • replayBatchSize – The number of random that will be replayed.

  • noReplay – If true, experiences are not replayed.

class CoBeLRL.agents.dyna_q_agent.PMAAgent(interfaceOAI, epsilon=0.3, beta=5, learningRate=0.9, gamma=0.99, trialEndFcn=None, gammaSR=0.99)

Bases: CoBeLRL.agents.dyna_q_agent.AbstractDynaQAgent

Implementation of a Dyna-Q agent using the Prioritized Memory Access (PMA) method described by Mattar & Daw (2019).

class callbacks(rlParent, trialEndFcn=None)

Bases: object

Callback class. Used for visualization and scenario control.

__init__(rlParent, trialEndFcn=None)

Inits Callback class

Parameters

  • rlParent – Reference to the Dyna-Q agent.

  • trialEndFcn – Maximum number of experiences that will be stored by the memory module.

on_episode_end(epoch, logs)

The following function is called whenever an episode ends, and updates the reward accumulator, simultaneously updating the visualization of the reward function.

Parameters

  • epoch – no. of complete episodes

  • logs – Maximum number of experiences that will be stored by the memory module.

Returns

None

__init__(interfaceOAI, epsilon=0.3, beta=5, learningRate=0.9, gamma=0.99, trialEndFcn=None, gammaSR=0.99)

Inits PMAgent class.

Parameters

  • interfaceOAI – The interface to the Open AI Gym environment.

  • epsilon – The epsilon value for the epsilon greedy policy.

  • beta – The temperature parameter used when applying the softmax function to the Q-values.

  • learningRate – The learning rate with which the Q-function is updated.

  • gamma – The discount factor used to compute the TD-error.

  • trialEndFcn – The callback function called at the end of each trial, defined for more flexibility in scenario control.

  • gammaSR – The temperature parameter

Returns

None

train(numberOfTrials=100, maxNumberOfSteps=50, replayBatchSize=100, noReplay=False)

This function is called to train the agent.

Parameters

  • numberOfTrials – The number of trials the Dyna-Q agent is trained.

  • maxNumberOfSteps – The maximum number of steps per trial.

  • replayBatchSize – The number of random that will be replayed.

  • noReplay – If true, experiences are not replayed.

Returns

None

update_Q(update)

This function updates the Q-function with a given experience.

Parameters

update – The experience with which the Q-function will be updated.

Returns

None
